The claim has been circulating since 201: indicating its longevity and widespread dissemination.
The claim has been debunked by fact: checking organizations such as Snopes, who disproved a similar false story in 2004.
Law enforcement agencies in Canada: including the Royal Canadian Mounted Police and the Ontario Provincial Police, have not received any reports or evidence of carjackings involving a paper stuck on the back window of a vehicle.
The claim is considered an urban legend: including Steve Kee from the Insurance Bureau of Canada and cybersecurity expert Joseph Steinberg, who highlight the difficulty of removing misinformation from platforms like Facebook.
